item.title: Aggregator 2.12.0
item.description:
The update history is back!

When I started to work on the new design of the update history I had these goals:

  • make it scrollable to cover a longer period of time
  • include visual hints for the passed time between updates
  • provide extended details for each update

To access the update history, navigate to a feed and select the Update history option from the overflow menu. If Aggregator failed to update the feed, the Update history option is available directly in the action bar.

Also, in the navigation drawer, feeds that failed to be updated are now highlighted.

Redirects

Starting with this version, Aggregator will handle both temporary and permanent redirects.

item.title: Aggregator 2.11.0
item.description:
What's new?

  • You can directly open the original article with the browser by pressing entry's feed icon in the entries list.
  • Long pressing the entry's feed icon, navigates you to that feed.

item.title: Aggregator 2.10.0
item.description:
What's new?

  • Renamed the Unread category to All, and added the option to show the read entries
  • The Show read entries is now permanent
  • Increased the entry list font size

item.title: Aggregator 2.9.0
item.description:
What's new?

  • Pull to refresh! Works on every entry list (unread, category or feed)
  • The update scheduler groups now feeds in slots of 15 minutes, for better battery life
  • D-Pad navigation support
  • Fixed the global entry rules

item.title: Aggregator 2.8.0
item.description:
What's new?

  • Full support for the Android 6.0 permission model
  • The exported OPML file includes now the entry rules too
  • Support for media description (present in feeds from Youtube)
  • The feed category is now displayed for each feed entry

item.title: Aggregator 2.7.0
item.description:
Aggregator 2.7.0 brings support for user-defined feed categories.

Collapsing or expanding a category can be done by long-pressing it.

To a assign a feed to a category one has to go to the feed preference activity, also accessible via a long-press.

Other changes:

  • light and dark themes for the entire app
  • fix for duplicate entries
  • fix for repeated notification sound and vibrations

item.title: Aggregator Howto Â» Entry Rules
item.description:
Aggregator uses user-defined entry rules to filter out the entries of a feed.

There are two types of rules: exclude rules, used to mark which entries should be hidden while aggregating a feed, and include rules, used to cancel the effect of some exclude rules.

Every entry rule defines a mask used to match the entries for which the rule action is applied. The % character is used to match zero, one or multiple characters, and can be used multiple times in a mask.

For example, the %aggregator% title mask will match every entry that contains aggregator in the title. While the % Vol % Ch % title mask will match every entry that contains both Vol and Ch (in the same order as present in the mask) in the title.

Excluding unwished entries

The easiest way to define rules that hide entries of a feed is by using the exclude action:

  1. Select the entry which you want to exclude by long pressing it.
  2. Click the exclude action from the action bar.

NOTE: Depending on your device type, the exclude action can be found either as as an action icon or as an option in the overflow menu.

HINT: Long pressing an icon in the action bar reveals the action name.

Excluding all entries except the whished ones

This is achieved by defining at least two rules:

  1. An exclude rule that hides every entry by using the following title mask: %
  2. One or more include rules that will cancel the effect of the exclude rule.

These rules are preferably created from the entry rules activity, which can be opened by clicking the entry rules option from the overflow menu.

NOTE: The entry rules activity lists all the rules of a feed, including the global ones, while also showing how many entries are matched by a rule.

item.title: Aggregator 2.6.0
item.description:
Aggregator is not dead... development is just (very) slow.

So what's new?

  • redesigned UI
  • exclude and include rules for feed entries
  • entry reader with new "show original" option
  • feed:// support
  • pinned entries: which are shown are unread until manually marked as read
